holidays.name: National Name Yourself Day
holidays.description: A playful day encouraging people to choose their own names for the day‚Äîwhether silly, cool, or completely made-up! Ideal for reinventing yourself or just having some naming fun.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday emerged from social media and online communities seeking a quirky way to break routine and express creativity.
holidays.funFact: Some people use this day to rename themselves with names of favorite fictional characters or alter egos, sparking virtual conversations and laughs!

holidays.name: Cherish an Antique Day
holidays.description: A day to honor and appreciate antiques and vintage items that tell stories from the past.
holidays.origin: Established by antique enthusiasts to promote the preservation and enjoyment of historical objects.
holidays.funFact: Collecting antiques surged in popularity partly due to this day inspiring people to explore flea markets and thrift shops!

holidays.name: Winston Churchill Day
holidays.description: Celebrating the life and legacy of Winston Churchill, British Prime Minister during WWII, known for his rousing speeches and indomitable spirit.
holidays.origin: Marks the birthdate of Winston Churchill, recognizing his impact on history and leadership.
holidays.funFact: Churchill was also an amateur painter and won a Nobel Prize in Literature‚Äînot just famous for politics!

holidays.name: Dyslexia Awareness Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to raising awareness about dyslexia and promoting understanding and support for those affected by it.
holidays.origin: Set by advocacy groups aiming to spotlight learning differences and reduce stigma.
holidays.funFact: About 1 in 10 people are dyslexic, but many are highly creative and successful in various fields!
